result.execSummary:
The defendant Moises Melendez-Roman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 4-19-2024.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with 22CF333, with credit for 87 DAYS served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Moises Melendez-Roman

defendant.name: Melendez-Roman, Moises
defendant.address: 1000 South 108th Street Lot A28, West Allis, WI 53227

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction; Concurrent with 22CF333, with credit for 87 DAYS served.  

The Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 4-19-2024.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Case proceeded to sentencing. 

FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Moises Melendez-Roman not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Moises Melendez-Roman appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Farm and Fleet
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Moises Melendez-Roman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
